parameters.name: state

post.description: Get access token from authorization code or refresh token

parameters.name: payload

Payload sent by client to obtain refresh and access token or to refresh an access token.
see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.3 and https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-6

error_description.description: Human readable ASCII text providing additional information

error_uri.example: Et eos consequatur autem deleniti sed.

TokenMedia.title: Mediatype identifier: application/vnd.goa.example.oauth2.token+json; view=default

access_token.description: The access token issued by the authorization server
access_token.example: Nisi ex velit amet eius tempora iusto.

expires_in.description: The lifetime in seconds of the access token

scope.description: The scope of the access token
scope.example: Qui dignissimos corrupti similique voluptatibus a alias.

token_type.description: The type of the token issued, e.g. "bearer" or "mac"
token_type.example: Est minima vel possimus enim saepe.

TokenMedia.description: OAuth2 access token request successful response, see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-5.1 (default view)

example.access_token: Nisi ex velit amet eius tempora iusto.
example.scope: Qui dignissimos corrupti similique voluptatibus a alias.
example.token_type: Est minima vel possimus enim saepe.

TokenPayload.title: TokenPayload

code.description: The authorization code received from the authorization server, used for initial refresh and access token request
code.example: Delectus aut libero nesciunt veniam reiciendis.

grant_type.description:
Value MUST be set to "authorization_code" when obtaining initial refresh and access token.
Value MUST be set to "refresh_token" when refreshing an access token.

redirect_uri.description: The redirect_uri parameter specified when making the authorize request to obtain the authorization code, used for initial refresh and access token request

refresh_token.description: The refresh token issued to the client, used for refreshing an access token
refresh_token.example: Et qui quia sed odio sint.

scope.description: The scope of the access request, used for refreshing an access token
scope.example: Iste laborum nostrum quidem sequi dolor.

TokenPayload.description:
Payload sent by client to obtain refresh and access token or to refresh an access token.
see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.3 and https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-6

example.code: Delectus aut libero nesciunt veniam reiciendis.
example.refresh_token: Et qui quia sed odio sint.
example.scope: Iste laborum nostrum quidem sequi dolor.

code.description: an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: a human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: Value of ID must be an integer

id.description: a unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

meta.description: a meta object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

example.detail: Value of ID must be an integer
